definition: to sauté/to stir-fry/to speculate/to hype/to fire (sb)

sentences.english: It is after all the capital of broken Britain.
sentences.chinese: 畢竟這是炒蛋英國的首都啊。

sentences.english: Scramble eggs all over the rocks.
Two Eggs Scrambled with Smoked Salmon, topped with Sour Cream and Chives on an English Muffin.
sentences.chinese: 煙燻三文魚炒蛋，配以酸奶油，香蔥和英式鬆餅。

sentences.english: After taking more scrambled eggs with Toona Sinensis.
Perl barley congee with nut, scrambled eggs, hamburger.
sentences.chinese: 漢堡，美式炒蛋，核桃薏米粥。

sentences.english: Readin' the paper in bed, sippin' coffee, scamblin' an egg or two.
sentences.chinese: 躺在牀上讀讀報，品品咖啡，來一兩個炒蛋。

sentences.english: You need a frying pan in order to make scrambled eggs.
sentences.chinese: 爲了做炒蛋你需要一個平底煎鍋。

sentences.english: Fried Chicken, Scrabble Egg with Tomato, Broccoli, SteamRice.
sentences.chinese: 雞排，番茄炒蛋，白飯，芥藍。

sentences.english: I'll tell her to get her own scrambled eggs.
sentences.chinese: 我會告訴他自己去弄炒蛋的。

sentences.english: The sauce will reduce and will look like scrambled eggs.
sentences.chinese: 咖喱醬會愈炒愈少，而且變成像炒蛋一般質感。

sentences.english: Some people think that doctors and nurses can put scrambled eggs back into the shell.
sentences.chinese: 有些人認爲，醫生與護士能把炒蛋變回蛋殼裏。

definition: poached egg/egg fried on both sides
salad with dressing/cold vegetables dressed with sauce (e.g. coleslaw)
